author: Dentons
title: PRA consults on SIMR for large NDFs
text:
PRA consults on SIMR for large NDFs more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=bd5c8f2c-52bc-4168-bbee-bbe394f534ed" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
PRA is consulting on further proposals for implementing the SIMR in relation to those NDFs with assets exceeding £25 million. It suggests: detailed proposals for the application of the SIMR to large NDFs; keeping the requirement for certain NDFs to appoint an actuarial function holder, and a with‐profits actuary; the transitional arrangements for all NDFs; the proposed new forms and updates to existing forms; retention of records of allocation of responsibilities to senior managers at NDFs; and new parts of the PRA Rulebook to apply to NDFs. 
The consultation includes a table mapping across current requirements to the proposed new rules. PRA seeks views by 12 October. (Source: PRA Consults on SIMR for Large NDFs )
